ancientpopgen-bingo.instructions: Once you get a bingo, add yourself to the leaderboard with your name!
lexicon: 🌐 A PCA is shown
🎩 Speaker mentions THE PCA that needs to no introduction
🗺 The John Novembre PCA that aligns with the European countries is shown
👨‍❤‍👨 'IBD will resolve that relationship'
👨‍❤‍👨 Performing kinship analysis just 'because'
🕶 Having >25 colours in PCA, and can no-longer distinguish them
👨🏻‍💼 David Reich or Reich lab mentioned
🌲 Ancestry mentioned 5 times in one minute
🔢 Never-ending series of slides of F-statistics results
⚔ Token first two slides of 'archaeological context' that is just pictures of pretty rare artefacts of the culture
🎠 Yamnaya or Steppe 'massive migration' mentioned
⬅️ Arrows on a map showing 'migration' based on genetic movement even though genetics can't show physical movement
🍓 Western Hunter-Gatherers or WHG mentioned
🌊 qpWave mentioned
🤫 X number of genomes mentioned when really they mean 'genome-wide' data
🎣 1240k capture mentioned
📊 ADMIXTURE graph shown
🖩 F3 and F4 statistics mentioned
🔧 Title says 'Ancient DNA <analysis/tool> reveals...' but is only for human pop-gen
🦠 Analysis of disease from pathogen screening as selling point, but as a 1-2 slide afterthought
∡ Cline on a PCA mentioned
🤯 We *simply* did <insert complex analysis here>
⚤ After a long talk of complex ancestry analysis, someone asks only about the sex of the individual
🤓 D-Statistics mentioned
👀 Big implications for the understanding of human history based on 1 'genome'
🌍 Someone asks 'what population did you use for that outgroup'
🗺️ MY (random) region/time period is relatively understudied
👴🏿 The first/oldest...<insert genome/period/region here>
🗣 Intensive analysis of site/region, but no explanation why this area is interesting
🗺 Show an otherwise useless C18th map of the region because pretty
🤦‍♀ No mention of any relevant previous anthropological work in the area or the collection
